intro: Schinus fagara, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree or the Christmas tree, is a species of flowering plant in the Anacardiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Brazil, Mexico, and the Caribbean. The plant is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree or shrub that can grow up to 10 meters tall. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a glossy dark green appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species.
